trans-unit.source: Refresh Tokens for Multiple Resources
trans-unit.target: Refresh Tokens for Multiple Resources

trans-unit.source: When using the <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>, you can configure the client to call multiple resources.
trans-unit.target: When using the <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>, you can configure the client to call multiple resources.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this would require a call to the authorization endpoint for each target service.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this would require a call to the authorization endpoint for each target service.

trans-unit.source: To avoid multiple calls and multiple user consent prompts, and reduce the number of refresh tokens the client needs to cache, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) has implemented <newTerm>multi-resource refresh tokens</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: To avoid multiple calls and multiple user consent prompts, and reduce the number of refresh tokens the client needs to cache, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) has implemented <newTerm>multi-resource refresh tokens</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: This feature allows you to use a single refresh token to request access tokens for multiple resources.
trans-unit.target: This feature allows you to use a single refresh token to request access tokens for multiple resources.

trans-unit.source: Register the Application in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Register the Application in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: To begin, create the client application and all resource applications and configure the call between the client and all service applications.
trans-unit.target: To begin, create the client application and all resource applications and configure the call between the client and all service applications.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the Azure Management Portal to register the application in your Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the Azure Management Portal to register the application in your Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Get an Access Token and Refresh Token
trans-unit.target: Get an Access Token and Refresh Token

trans-unit.source: If you are building a native client application, use the procedure described in <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link> to get an authorization code, and then exchange the authorization code for an access token and a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: If you are building a native client application, use the procedure described in <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link> to get an authorization code, and then exchange the authorization code for an access token and a refresh token.

trans-unit.source: Or, if you are building a web service, follow the instructions in <link xlink:href="6faab4b7-3c73-44df-b00d-fa517d1a1496" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials</link> to get an access token and a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: Or, if you are building a web service, follow the instructions in <link xlink:href="6faab4b7-3c73-44df-b00d-fa517d1a1496" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials</link> to get an access token and a refresh token.

trans-unit.source: Request Another Access Token
trans-unit.target: Request Another Access Token

trans-unit.source: Use a refresh token to request an access token for any other resource that the client is permitted to call.
trans-unit.target: Use a refresh token to request an access token for any other resource that the client is permitted to call.

trans-unit.source: To do this, set the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter in the request to the targeted resource.
trans-unit.target: To do this, set the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter in the request to the targeted resource.

trans-unit.source: Additional Access Token Request with a Refresh Token
trans-unit.target: Additional Access Token Request with a Refresh Token

trans-unit.source: To request an access token to an additional resource, use a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: To request an access token to an additional resource, use a refresh token.

trans-unit.source: When you use a refresh token, the parameter in the POST request are identical to the parameters that you would use to request an access token when an original access token expires.
trans-unit.target: When you use a refresh token, the parameter in the POST request are identical to the parameters that you would use to request an access token when an original access token expires.

trans-unit.source: The only difference is that the resource parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The only difference is that the resource parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: client_id
trans-unit.target: client_id

trans-unit.source: [Optional] The client ID of the native client application that is registered in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] The client ID of the native client application that is registered in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: grant_type
trans-unit.target: grant_type

trans-unit.source: [Required] Indicates the type of grant being used.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Indicates the type of grant being used.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the value must be <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the value must be <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: refresh_token
trans-unit.target: refresh_token

trans-unit.source: [Required] The refresh token that was included in the response that provided the access token.
trans-unit.target: [Required] The refresh token that was included in the response that provided the access token.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: [Required] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).
trans-unit.target: [Required] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).

trans-unit.source: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, a native client application is using a refresh token to request an access token for the https://service.fabrikam.com/resource web API.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, a native client application is using a refresh token to request an access token for the https://service.fabrikam.com/resource web API.

trans-unit.source: Additional Access Token Response with a Refresh Token
trans-unit.target: Additional Access Token Response with a Refresh Token

trans-unit.source: A successful response to an access token request that includes a refresh token includes the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: A successful response to an access token request that includes a refresh token includes the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: This response is identical to the response that is sent when you use a refresh token to request an new access token for the same resource.
trans-unit.target: This response is identical to the response that is sent when you use a refresh token to request an new access token for the same resource.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: access_token
trans-unit.target: access_token

trans-unit.source: The new access token that was requested.
trans-unit.target: The new access token that was requested.

trans-unit.source: expires_in
trans-unit.target: expires_in

trans-unit.source: The remaining lifetime of the token in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The remaining lifetime of the token in seconds.

trans-unit.source: A typical value is 3600 (one hour).
trans-unit.target: A typical value is 3600 (one hour).

trans-unit.source: expires_on
trans-unit.target: expires_on

trans-unit.source: The date and time on which the token expires.
trans-unit.target: The date and time on which the token expires.

trans-unit.source: The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.
trans-unit.target: The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.

trans-unit.source: refresh_token
trans-unit.target: refresh_token

trans-unit.source: A new OAuth 2.0 refresh_token that can be used to request new access tokens when the one in this response expires.
trans-unit.target: A new OAuth 2.0 refresh_token that can be used to request new access tokens when the one in this response expires.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: Identifies the secured resource that the access token can be used to access.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the secured resource that the access token can be used to access.

trans-unit.source: scope
trans-unit.target: scope

trans-unit.source: Impersonation permissions granted to the native client application.
trans-unit.target: Impersonation permissions granted to the native client application.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is <embeddedLabel>user_impersonation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is <embeddedLabel>user_impersonation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The owner of the target resource can register alternate values in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The owner of the target resource can register alternate values in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: token_type
trans-unit.target: token_type

trans-unit.source: The token type.
trans-unit.target: The token type.

trans-unit.source: The only supported value is <embeddedLabel>bearer</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The only supported value is <embeddedLabel>bearer</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample response to an access token request that includes a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample response to an access token request that includes a refresh token.
